definitions.definition: A sense of awe , astonishment and curiosity , inspired by unexpected events , novel experiences and inexplicable circumstances, sometimes accompanied by surprise , shock or reverence .
Something that causes amazement or awe ; a marvel .
examples: Wonders of the World seem to come in sevens.
That stay in the country did her wonders .
It's a wonder no-one saw me.

subdefinitions.definition: An astonishing and seemingly inexplicable turn of events .
examples: The idea was so ridiculous that it's a wonder anyone went along with it.

subdefinitions.definition: A feat that demonstrates incredible finesse or skill , as if performed by magic .
examples: Given the limited resources, he's really performed wonders .

subdefinitions.definition: Someone very talented at something, a genius .
A nominalizer that serves as a head noun for the preceding adjective , which together form a mocking or insulting epithet .
examples: So the voiceless wonder speaks at last.
labels: following an adjective ending -less that typically has two syllables
subdefinitions.label_groups: colloquial , sarcastic , following an adjective ending -less that typically has two syllables

definitions.definition: A kind of donut ; a cruller .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) A sense of awe , astonishment and curiosity , inspired by unexpected events , novel experiences and inexplicable circumstances, sometimes accompanied by surprise , shock or reverence .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) Something that causes amazement or awe ; a marvel .
( countable , UK , informal ) A mental pondering, a thought .
( countable , US ) A kind of donut ; a cruller .
